question: お手洗い
sourceMnemonic: You know that <ja>手洗い</ja> is "handwashing" (and also a not as polite way to mention a bathroom). When you add <ja>お</ja> you're suddenly making it polite. Why? Because you're talking about something a little more crass than handwashing. You're talking about the <vocabulary>toilet</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>restroom</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>bathroom</vocabulary>. Ewww. Poop goes there.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>手洗い</ja>, so if you know that you'll know this too!
